# Beyond ggplot2 Fundamentals

## 1 Installing and Loading the required library

### 1.1 check the required packages: ggrepel, ggthemes, hrbrthemes, patchwork, ggplot2


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pacman::p_load(ggrepel, patchwork, ggthemes,
               hrbrthemes, tidyverse, ggplot2)
```
:::


## 2 Importing data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
exam_data <- read.csv("data/Exam_data.csv")
```
:::


##### *reader is one of the tidyverse package*

## 3 Beyond ggplot2 Annotation:ggrepel


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, size = 0.5) +
  geom_label(aes(label = ID),
             hjust = 0.5,
             vjust = -.5) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0,100),
                  ylim = c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


##### *orignal plot*


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = exam_data,
       aes(x = MATHS, y = ENGLISH)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = lm, size = 0.5) +
  geom_label_repel(aes(label = ID),
             hjust = 0.5,
             vjust = -.5) +
  coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0,100),
                  ylim = c(0,100)) +
  ggtitle("English scores versus Maths scores for Primary 3")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


##### *using ggrepel*

## 4 Beyond ggplot2 Themes

### 4.1 Built_in themes

##### *eight built_in themes: theme_gray(), theme_bw(), theme_classic(), theme_dark(), theme_light(), theme_linedraw(), theme_minimal(), and theme_void()*

#### 4.1.1 theme_gray


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
ggplot(data = exam_data, aes(x = MATHS)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 20, boundary = 100, color = "grey25",
                 fill = "grey90") +
  theme_gray() +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Maths scores")
```

## 6 Creating Composite Graphics: pathwork mehods

### 6.1 Combining two ggplot2 graphs


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p1 + p2
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-20-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### 6.2 Combining three ggplot2 graphs


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
(p1/p2)|p3
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-21-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### 6.3 Creating a composite figure with tag


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
(p1/p2)|p3 +
  plot_annotation(tag_levels = "I")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-22-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### 6.4 Creating figure with insert


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p3 + inset_element(p2,
                   left = 0.02,
                   bottom = 0.7,
                   right = 0.5,
                   top = 1)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Hands-on_Ex02_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-23-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


### 6.5 Creating a compostie figure by using patchwork and ggtheme


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
patchwork <- (p1/p2)|p3 
patchwork & theme_economist()
```
